intro: Euphrasia canadensis, commonly known as Canadian eyebright, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has hairy, erect stems with opposite leaves. It is often found in the northeastern United States and parts of Canada. Euphrasia canadensis is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its purported health benefits.
